title: To amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to provide for a reduction in the limitation amount for multicandidate political committee contributions to candidates, and for other purposes.
content: Amends the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to reduce permitted contribution amounts to Federal candidates by multicandidate political committees. Prohibits a House of Representatives candidate from accepting contributions from a multicandidate political committee in excess of 50 percent of all contributions accepted by such candidate during a reporting period. Limits contributions which a House of Representatives candidate may accept from other than in-State residents. Removes contribution limitations for congressional candidates whose opponents intend to spend or spend $100,000 or more from personal sources. Prohibits leadership committees. Revises contribution through intermediary provisions.
